title: Print, "Seated Shepherd Playing with a Dog", 1770–75
medium: Crayon manner engraving on heavy cream laid paper
markings: Mark:  Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration stamp in brown, lower center right, verso:  Lugt 457e
signed: Imprinted in red-brown ink, lower left margin: J.B. Huët inv. del. 1770.; lower right margin:  Demarteau l'ainé sc./N°. 213
inscribed: Imprinted in red-brown ink, lower center:  A Paris chéz Demarteau Graveur du Roi rue de la Pelterie a la Choche
description: Crayon manner print in red-brown ink.  Young boy is seated on the ground facing left.  He leans against a shoulder bag and cape[?] and holds a shepherd's walking stick in his right hand.  He gestures to the little dog (at his left), who stands up on hind legs in a begging pose.

tombstone.epitaph: Print, "Seated Shepherd Playing with a Dog", 1770–75.Crayon manner engraving on heavy cream laid paper. 1923-21-2.
